website_summaries.verdict: A high-end soundbar with a low-end price tag, it strikes an ideal balance between audio quality, size, and format support.
pros: The included wireless subwoofer can be placed anywhere
Supports DTS Virtual:X, which deftly simulates the best-in-class DTS:X surround sound audio format
cons: No internet connectivity means all firmware updates must be done via the USB port

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work even after being sent back to Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Yamaha receiver in my media room for years and have been very happy with it. I have had nothing but trouble with this soundbar. It is in a living room and the sub woofer kept making a popping sound so I sent it back for repair. Yamaha covered the repair, but I had to pay over $50 to ship it to them. I received it back after being "refurbished" and now the sub woofer will not pair with the sound bar, so essentially it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Rips

customer_reviews.title: One reason only
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I was looking for in a sound bar was clarity for movies, etc on Netflix and Amazon. Did not want to spend a mountain of money so looked into the $300 range. After way too much research ordered the Yamaha. My opinion..... Bluetooth may or may not work, do not care. Listened to some music from Pandora and sound was good, sub woofer can vibrate the walls. But the real deal was the clarity which was much better than the $150 sound bar that was replaced. No longer had to increase the sound to catch dialogue. Very senior friendly. Remote easy to use. Has made listening much easier.
customer_reviews.author: terry brown

customer_reviews.title: Subwoofer Died After 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Subwoofer would no longer pair after 1 month. It took over 1.5 hours for me to get through to someone in their support chat. They had me ship them some info and the cords ($14.93), and they say they will send a replacement. Huge pain! Update: The new unit they sent was also not getting sound out of the subwoofer, so I followed their "horrible" directions. This sub is also stuck on standby. Hoping when their support opens on Monday I can get a refund and send this thing to the dumpster. If you have to buy yamaha get the 107 with the sub that has a physical output connection.
customer_reviews.author: T Why

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 and a half months.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound bar in the beginning. Now it stopped working out of the blue. All lights are off...I called the company I got told that the unit is not repairable and they sent me a new one . Replacement arrived within a week! I got told over the phone that I need to unplug the unit off every time I am not using the unit! I found that odd .
customer_reviews.author: Nikos  batsos

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working properly in less than 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Sound from the soundbar was decent, but not as louder as comparably or lesser priced soundbars. Subwoofer is HUGE, but the bass it puts out is mediocre at best. Expected much better performance from something that takes up such a considerable footprint. SUMMARY: average soundbar that carries way too high of a pricetag. The VIZIO SB3621n-F8M 36 offers much better performance (louder, clearer soundbar; much more impactful bass; less overall footprint) for almost half the price. Oh, and the soundbar stopped functioning within 2 weeks of purchase. Amazon didn't even want it back.
customer_reviews.author: AwRy108

customer_reviews.title: Excellent soundbar
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Excellent sound quality and deep booming bass. I don't think I could have gotten a better soundbar for the money. For anyone new to subwoofers, there is a fairly constant rumble when watching some content. This is normal with subs in my experience. We generally just use the subwoofer for movies and action shows. There is a convenient button on the remote to turn the sub on and off.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lebron

customer_reviews.title: TWO defective units
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue where the optical input failed on the first unit and Amazon replaced it with another one. That unit, two months later, is now continuously turning itself off due to overheating issues. It is not in an enclosed space and has plenty of airflow around it. The temp of the house is a constant 69 degrees. I would give this 0 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, had 2 cease up on me back to back
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while it worked, I had to stop working on me, one after couple of months, the next one last alot less (3 days). Both units were fine when I went to sleep, the next morning on each unit they just wouldnt turn on anymore! Upgraded to the yas-706 & believe it or not I preferred the sound and bass of this model which is 1/3 the price of the yas-706, but the 706 has been working fine since June so I'm happy cause I have a sound bar that actually works now
customer_reviews.author: Craig DiLullo

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Polk Audio system that recently crapped out. Yamaha makes excellent musical instruments so I was hoping to see the same type of quality with a piece of their sound equipment. So far so good. The bass can be a bit muddy at times and I've had to play with the sub-woofer here and there. This may be due to the audio signal at the input though. It looks good and was extremely easy to set up. No issues with the sub-woofer pairing to the soundbar either. The one improvement I would like to have seen is an on/off switch on the sub-woofer too. Overall though it's not a bad unit.
customer_reviews.author: Heddon 25

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic at higher volumes, but...
customer_reviews.text: It sounds really fantastic at higher volumes, but at lower volumes certain frequencies noticeably clip in and out, which is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Bursavich

customer_reviews.title: Failed in a month unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was great when it worked. HDMI passthrough has stopped working after a month of being installed. Multiple cables and devices were used to verify it is the soundbar itself. Not looking forward to playing the warranty game. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: jacob bristol

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working completely after 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't even owned this for a year and it completely stopped working, doesn't look like it's covered through warranty either due to Yamaha's restrictive policy. Guess I'm out of $250, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Better for the same money. Yamaha did a horrible job with the YAS-207.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is sub par, it's always booming even when their is no low notes playing. Sub worked for a few months but stopped working. Guess it's talked about every where but amazon. If you have this issue: Turn off sound bar Press and home subwoofer down volume till dlp light blinks (if all lights turn on, you held it too long) Press pairing until connected with turns yellow.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rost

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: The sound bar was great. Loved the sound. Nice and rich without distortion. Great for movies. However it only lasted 4 months before it died. It just stopped working in the middle of a movie. When I checked to see what the problem was, it was extremely hot. Going to call the manufacturer, but overall disappointed I didn't even get a year out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great when it works
customer_reviews.text: Soundbar/subwoofer sounded great when they worked. Multiple times per week the Soundbar would just stop working and couldn’t be fixed. Spent hours troubleshooting, changing inputs, and power cycling the Soundbar and nothing would make it work. Magically, the next night it would work again. This has happened several times and just isn’t acceptable. Wish I could keep it because it sounded great, but I will unfortunately be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Soundbar Not Surround System
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a surround bar. I have previously used 5.1 and 7.1 Dolby receivers. The bar does sound good, has volume that will be acceptable to most people, and is affordable. The bar can not create sound spacing anything close to a real surround system with positioned speakers. It does create a slightly deeper field than just three speakers in front of you, but no where close to sounding like things are behind, beside, or above you. If you are limited on space or don't want to install multiple speakers it is a good compromise, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding sound quality and bass. Simple and complete remote. Surround mode is a bit overwhelming.
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional clarity and bass response. Well-written manual, easy to set up. Clearly labeled and intuitive remote control. The surround-sound mode produces a dramatic 3D effect with much louder volumes; it’s impressive and fun after getting used to it. Slim design fits nicely under most bigger TVs. Would have liked to see a ‘night mode’ effect for compressing levels to allow listening at lower volumes. Some TVs can do that, but need to dig into the TV settings.
customer_reviews.author: DaveKar

customer_reviews.title: Same subwoofer issues as everyone else.....
customer_reviews.text: First review I’ve ever written, the subwoofer lost connection constantly. It was a constant problem until the subwoofer lost signal and would not reconnect. Not the first to have this problem, it must be a design flaw. On top of this Yamaha charges you to send it in for warranty repairs. The cost to send this in this $50, a third of the new price. What a waste of money. Very disappointed with Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bar has potential but for me not great execution
customer_reviews.text: The sub on my unit would cut in and out over and over. It paired just fine but would cut in and out. Also the dtx feature to me sounded very synthetic. I called tech support who were helpful in trying to get it fixed but ultimately told me to return to amazon to get an exchange. I purchased the JBL 3.1 bar and sub and it is much much better sounding in the mids and highs without all the tinny sound. It also has 3 hdmi inputs plus an arc output which is more helpful passing through hdr/4K signals from several devices.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Trouble syncing subwoofer to soundbar?
customer_reviews.text: For $300, you're not going to find a better soundbar. The sound once synced with the subwoofer is outstanding. I did have an issue syncing the subwoofer to the soundbar. I followed the instructions, but the standby light on the subwoofer kept blinking, and was not syncing as expected. The solution? Unplug both the soundbar and subwoofer. Plug the subwoofer back in first, followed by the soundbar, and go through the steps again (it took doing this twice for mine to sync). Once it did, sound/musical nirvana. Even for $500 or less, you're not going to find a better system, it blows my previous Samsung unit away. Take care.
customer_reviews.author: JJL2U

customer_reviews.title: OK till dead at 7 months.
customer_reviews.text: We've had a Yamaha piano, outboard motor, other electronics, and a bunch of motorcycles and all have been trouble free. This sound bar worked well for under 7 months, but turned on the TV one night and the sound bar was just dead.
customer_reviews.author: BobS

customer_reviews.title: A perfect addition to the 52" LG we have.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality has been really been impressive. The installation easy as pie. Do enjoy having indicator lights to inform you of the volume or bass level. No guessing. Remote has great range of use. Bass is enjoyable. Clear voice dos make some difference, but not 100%. Would have to hear other units to see if this is market standard, but not going through all those purchases, nor are we heading to a Circuit City, oh they are closed, to compare either. Overall it has really enhanced the enjoyment of out entertainment time.
customer_reviews.author: Curly

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome soundbar. Don’t have to have 2 remotes to ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally reviewed this sounbar and have it 4 stars. Sounded great but subwoofer had a mind of its own. I’ve since returned it for a refund. Subwoofer is a piece of garbage. It worked half the time and cut in and out. It had to go. Replaced it with a JBL Bar 3.1. The difference is huge. If you can afford the JBL go for it. Don’t know how Yamaha can sell a product with this high of a failure rate. Reviews all over the web complain about the subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and good price!
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and good price! Bought to upgrade sound on our older 50" Panasonic plasma tv - remember those? Easy to hang on the brackets below the tv. Linked up instantly with the tv and Xfinity remote controls, integrating nicely with the various controls. Has a variety of audio options - though I am not sure I can hear the differences among some of them with my 70+ - year-old ears. We like it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The blue tooth connection also makes my songs on my cell phone sound fantastic. The low profile of the bar makes it ...
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal sound compared to what I had before the installation of the YAS-207BL. My 46" Samsung Touch of Color did not have a HDMI (ARC) but with the optical cable provided with the sound bar making the connection and the DTS X upgrade and the Clear Voice mode it really makes a significant difference in voice clarity and in bass and overall sound. The blue tooth connection also makes my songs on my cell phone sound fantastic. The low profile of the bar makes it compatible with using the remote associated with the television when the bar is placed at the pedestal base of the screen. Highly recommend this speaker set.
customer_reviews.author: Larry A Miller

customer_reviews.title: Magical is Right
customer_reviews.text: I read a prior review the mentioned the 3D sound as magical and I agree. It has great bass while still being able to hear people talking and no gigantic spikes in sound with special effects. Even at a low volume, you get the full range of sound that seems to be coming from all around you. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: major fail twice
customer_reviews.text: its ok if it only worked.. sub woofer cuts in/out badly, Badly...yamaha told me that symptom is death... amazon service was great..took care of me great.. rec'd 2nd unit... exact same critical fubar problem.. two units insta-fail...pretty pizzed off bout it
customer_reviews.author: D. S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't take the gamble
customer_reviews.text: The dropped the price of this $50 last Christmas and I had a gift card so I took the gamble even after the reliability issues noted in other reviews. Don't make the same mistake. The sound is very good, very, very good for the $...while it lasts. 7 months later the woofer is not making it's bluetooth connection with the sound bar. It's shocking how bad the bar is without the sub, the TVs speakers sound better! It's sad that a company of the caliber of Yamaha would not fix this problem that's been know about for some time.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Best soundbar for the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around first before purchasing this soundbar. We had a Vizio soundbar and it was terrible. Most reviews had placed this soundbar at the top or close to the top of the list. When it was Prime Day, this came out on special so I decided to get it. I am so glad I did. This is so easy to hook up, control the sound with the remote, control the bass. It works great. I am so glad it is so easy to use. I can point the remote anywhere in the room and it will work. It doesn't have to be pointed directly at the bar like the Vizio one. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: BIG sound coming out of a small package..
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to become the sound component of our downstairs entertainment center. Instead of using the TV sound (which we turn down), we run the optical audio-out cable from the TV to the Yamaha and control the sound using the Yamaha remote. What a difference! More of a surround effect and the base is amazing - but not overpowering of the voice (which can be enhanced using "Clear Voice"). Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: BradB

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality - midrange and low frequency is awful
customer_reviews.text: The mid range out of the center speaker is hollow and tinny sounding, regardless of settings used. Do not recommend this product, it was a downgrade in sound quality from the audio coming directly out of the TV. The base also seems to activate with odd thumping sounds while on standard tv programming. Unless I am watching an action movie, I have it turned off.
customer_reviews.author: John Cooke

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY AND TIME.
customer_reviews.text: Could not connect via HDMI as shown in the info booklet. Had to connect with video cable although I had the required unit in our new smart TV. Hear popping sound. Not worth the money. The sound is loud for music then soft for voices. Had a person look at it but said it wasn't a good unit. Emergency hospital and now Amazon sent info too late to return. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Really excellent system!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to spend a lot of money, but I think that the DTS Virtual: X Virtual 3D is really incredible; there is a very clear difference to regular surround sound. Whenever I wonder if I made the right choice in my sound bar I always come back to the DTS Virtual: X Virtual 3D and feel confident about my decision. That being said, it was a bit of a trick to connect the bass to the bar and I sometimes wish for an extra speaker to angle into a different room, but otherwise I am quite satisfied with this system. I think my 5 star review should testify to that!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hartzell

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: We live in a wonderful age where we can research the crap out of things before we purchase. The reviews of the YAS-207 are overwhelmingly positive and I’m here to add to that. Aesthetically, this is subtle and clean. The remote works great as does controlling via the app. Hookup also couldn’t be easier. The sound? It’s great! It’s not going to arouse audiophiles but at this price ($229 as of today) expecting such would be ridiculous. The bass also knocks plenty for an old head like me. Overall, the YAS-207 is a YUGE upgrade over my tv’s skimpy speakers and also my Bose SoundLink Plus. Money well spent and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: It's not 3.1,5.1, etc, but far better than 2.0 or less
customer_reviews.text: Negative:. Button battery on the remote. C'mon Yamaha, AAA batteries please? Otherwise, I'm not looking to wake the family from upstairs, the room isn't so large as to require a 300watt Boomer. The clear voice works well enough to disable text on screen for most shows, the bass kicks well enough. If you want more, get a Sonos Atmos or whatever as they're better and enjoy it. This is enough for me. And I did try lesser soundbars. Well worth it. Have yet to blow the family away with it, it will get immersive (loud) in this room.
customer_reviews.author: cowtown_horn

customer_reviews.title: Big Sound in a Sleek Package!
customer_reviews.text: Having always had a surround sound receiver as part of my entertainment system, i was a little hesitant to "downgrade" to a sound bar and subwoofer. I could not have been more wrong! The sound bar produces a very clean sound with a lot of "body" for explosions and other loud sounds. While it may not be a true surround sound speaker system, the sound coming from the bar is very robust and feels like it is wrapping around you. I would highly recommend this setup for anyone with a smaller room or who doesn't want to run a bunch of speaker wire!
customer_reviews.author: G.G.

customer_reviews.title: subwoofer died after 2-1/2 months  *update*
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't ask for better sound for $200. LED indicator lights for volume a bit annoying as they are not accurate, but better than no volume lights i guess. Wish it held up like it supposed to (fyi: it was treated gently) I'll contact seller and see how helpful they are. *update* the manual did not help me with my problem, i figured the sub was toast. Luckily my wife (the smart one in the family) called Yamaha directly and they helped us reset the center speaker and re-link the bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: PixelPusher

customer_reviews.title: Thought it could replace my old Polk Audio MagniFi One Sound Bar and Wireless Subwoofer System.
customer_reviews.text: The plan was to replace my beloved (4 year old) Polk Audio MagniFi One Sound Bar and Wireless Subwoofer System. It has detail, Spatiality and warmth with a good degree of adjustment potential for midrange. Originally, purchased this Yamaha YAS207 and used it for 3 days. Based on Yamaha experience. The bass is deep and powerful, but the sound bar seemed to project a thin, "tin can" like sound for all voices and background details. It took a while to really blend the voice and background sounds, with the bass, but it always sounded thin and cold with too much emphasis on voices. I'm bummed. Yamaha YAS207 wasn't for me. For $300 there are better options.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Matejovsky

customer_reviews.title: Good bargain
customer_reviews.text: I am probably the least qualified to comment on this product. It was not the current model so Amazon had it at a huge discount. My room is definitely not conducive for the DTS:X function and I have terrible hearing due to severe allergies affecting my hearing. However, even in my terribly-proportioned room, sometimes my hearing temporarily improvs and I am amazed by the sound. My only complaint, although the dialogue mode makes a big difference, I was hoping for a little more center channel emphasis. Also, I wish it could make everything the same volume level. Some commercials are noticeably louder. YouTube videos, notorious for poor audio, aren’t improved at all.
customer_reviews.author: mary cook

customer_reviews.title: The subwoofer is known to have issues
customer_reviews.text: Got the item and hooked it up to check the sound quality using a amazon basics hdmi arc compatible cable. I was happily surprised by sound. Spent hours on a Saturday fishing wires to hang the bar so that no wires show. After hours of effort and hooking up the woofer is no longer working. The standby light keeps blinking. I have tried turning the unit off and pressing the “-“ button under woofer, the units do not sync. I have ppl coming over tomm to watch Sunday 🏈 and no bass ... thanks Yamaha , if this was an apple product I am sure we wouldn’t have had this issue !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hassan B. Javaid

customer_reviews.title: Great soundbar!
customer_reviews.text: Update: the “surround sound” is pretty great. It’s very subtle and took me a while to pick it up. One movie made me turn around and go “is it raining outside”?! Amazing sound for the price. Setup was a breeze...HDMI in from PS4 Pro, HMDI out to ARC on my tv and everything works perfectly...It doesn’t auto detect the input so you’ll have to switch the mode (HDMI, TV etc) whenever you change inputs but that’s no big deal. The subwoofer was larger than I expected and produced very deep rich bass. The whole room literally feels like it’s rumbling. At medium volume you can definitely wake up the neighbors! I love it
customer_reviews.author: David Micklewhyte

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting quality for this price.. but holy crap.
customer_reviews.text: Are there better systems out there? Absolutely. Is a sound bar handicapped by the nature of it being just one long set of speakers? Probably. But for the price and form factor, this is incredible. The clarity is incredible, though keep in mind positioning in a suboptimal place will affect sound quality. Put the volume up, throw on a movie, and be amazed. For the size of the whole unit, it's amazing how much sound(and how great of quality) comes out of it
customer_reviews.author: Chester Harrington

customer_reviews.title: ARC HDMI Connection kept disconnecting back to TV speakers.
customer_reviews.text: ARC HDMI was activated on my Sony Bravia TV and yet when I followed the instructions for implementing HDMI control (after holding HDMI button for 3+ seconds with bar turned off), the bar just turned the TB indicator on the bar. Based on comments from other users, there was of course nobody at the corporation to ask for help..I mean nothing, no email no phone number. What a junk corporation. After 5 days it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: TheBushranger

customer_reviews.title: Not actual surround sound but pretty neat.
customer_reviews.text: The wireless subwoofer is amazing. There is no setup. All you have to do is plug it in. The surround sound was not as amazing as other reviews made it seem to be, but I’m used to my actual 5.1 Polk audio surround sound setup upstairs. For the price amazon had this for (160) it was a great buy. The shipping sucked as it was “guaranteed” one day delivery. A week and a half later I received the replacement unit as it was labeled as lost in transit.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Blown away.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what an amazing sound bar. I replaced my old Samsung sound bar with this Yamaha YAS207 and easily one of the best purchases I made. The sound quality is unbelievably good. The bass, phew, I felt my entire living room shaking. The surround sound is no joke either. Watched an episode of GOT where the scene takes place in the dining hall, and I heard people’s voices coming from all directions! This Yamaha sound bar blows my cheap Samsung out of the water easily.
customer_reviews.author: Calen Said

customer_reviews.title: A really good sound bar.
customer_reviews.text: Easily set up. (Note that the the light link is the way to get sound from the tv to the speakers, not HDMI, although HDMI should get connected for some nice features, like turning on the speakers when the tv is turned on.) Sound is very good. There are lots of options for music or tv sound. The voice enhancement works great. The 3-D simulation sounds great for tv watching, but I turn it off for music. I actually like the voice enhancement for music because it seems to accentuate the midrange. Experiment to get what you like. Bass is solid. I really like that I can independently control the bass from the hand unit. Over a really good soundbar.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Urbana

customer_reviews.title: You gotta be kidding me
customer_reviews.text: Don't get too excited about your new sound bar being delivered. Time to get in the car and run to home depot. After the instructions insist it being installed by a pro, they inform you that the "commercially available screws" go in the provided template. That's right. It sits on the floor till you go get some drywall anchors. Am I the only one who read multiple reviews about the best under $300 soundbar, completely missed the part about no included hardware?
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot connect the Sub woofer
customer_reviews.text: The sound is very good for the Sound Bar, but the Sub Woofer connected briefly, but will no longer connect. I sent it to my son in California and need to get it back to double check. I will return this if I cannot get it to connect.
customer_reviews.author: JVJ

customer_reviews.title: Very good sounbar....but not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I downgraded from a 5.1 setup to this soundbar for a cleaner look. The speaker sounds very good and setup was a breeze. I would have given this product a 4 star rating but it broke within 3 mo. The ARC stopped working and the optical input was loose. Thankfully Yamaha has great customer service and replaced my defective item. Hopefully the new soundbar will last longer, if so I will upgrade my rating to a 4.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: good sound quality, deep bass, better balance than Vizio
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for the old Vizio 5.1 soundbar, which stopped working only after 3 years. This Yamaha soundbar and wireless subwoofer offers great sound quality and deep bass. Compared to the Vizio 5.1 channel, it has better balance in the sound and the bass. The packaging was easy to open and everything well secured inside. The quick set-up guide that came with the instruction manual was easy to follow. Hope it can be used for a longer time.
customer_reviews.author: kkbear

customer_reviews.title: Listen to others and do not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: We have another system with speakers and wires all along the walls and I was looking for something more tidy. This system is much inferior. When I received the package, it had tape on it indicating that it had already been returned once. The controls are painful to use and not intuitive at all. The sound is not even a tiny bit better than the TV alone. The box is huge and cumbersome to unpack and repack to return. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Dang ...another bad soundbar
customer_reviews.text: Wow...I used to love everything Yamaha . So much bass and no matter what you do you cant get rid of the rumble. Rumble is so much there you cant appreciate the actual sound which Im sure is great. To bad they didn't perfect this in the least. Secondary HDMI forget that too it doesn't work either.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough with good base
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in place of built in TV speakers. I feel these have about the same dynamic range of my TV speakers at normal volumes. Does perform a bit better at a higher volumes. Did not change the "dB to setting" ratio though; still have the crank it when watching Netflix for some reason. Base however blows away the TV speakers when watching movies! Would recommend for the money. If you're more particular about sound, spend more for something like Klipsch!
customer_reviews.author: tgidds72

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Sounds like we're in a theatre. I am no sound expert, but when the woofer gets going during a battle scene in a movie, it really adds to the experience. Saving Private Ryan was intense. Set up easy. Just a tad too wide for our 55 in TV stand legs, but that was my fault. Should have measured. Easy workaround and am really enjoying the TV more.
customer_reviews.author: A guy

customer_reviews.title: Look else where
customer_reviews.text: It's OK. I expected alot more. Be using daily for 4 months. Subwoofer will randomly cut out for a while then come back on. It is located next to the sound bar so it should be close enough. Any closer it would be on top of it. Bass sound is very distorted if not turned up loud. If you listen to loud music and movies all the time then it's great. Just for normal TV use I would not recommend it. We are going to pretty much use it for movies.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: So far So good
customer_reviews.text: I've just plugged everything in. Bass is rumbling. Surround & HD sound is fabulous. Comcast remote is paired. Samsung S9 is paired. Google Assist with Google Mini & Chromecast wireless workaround is next! My LG Soundbar was adequate but this is already sounding so much better. Nice for the price. I did a lot of research and just feel that the SmartHome audio functionality with Soundbar audio options just isn't up to par.... yet. This Yamaha is excellent and will work just fine with the Chromcast workaround for smarthome functionality. Can't wait to explore and really test out the functionality in the coming days.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Boskovic

customer_reviews.title: For the price, you could do a lot better
customer_reviews.text: I am a little disappointed with this purchase. The unit is very sloid and well put together. Doesn’t feel cheap at all. But the sound quality is lacking. I purchased this unit because of the brand name. My son and daughter have a lot cheaper brands that sound a lot better than this unit. It is easy to connect and use and the sound is ok but for the price, I would look elsewhere. I do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Mind Blown!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound, Make sure you update it to get the best sound after that it rocks. This thing has my walls shaking. Lol.. Well worth $300 wish I would've got one years ago now I have to spend my time re watching my favorite movies to get the full experience. If your on the fence with this just get it you won't be disipointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Bar
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this sound bar since Christmas 2018 and I am very satisfied with it. I use it to watch TV shows mainly and play video games every once in a while. I have had no issues with setup or performance to speak of. The different options it comes with such as bass booster, surround sound, and clear voice are great! However, it is still difficult to hear voices in some shows, but I am not sure if this is more of an issue with the show or this system. Overall, great purchase and I plan to use it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Rogers

customer_reviews.title: VIZIO is Better
customer_reviews.text: It's strength is the bass. The DTS is cool if you aren't living in an apartment and can really blast the volume. With that massive subwoofer, it does have some power, but you have to listen to it loudly. It is terrible for using in an apartment. The clear voice feature is absolutely necessary at all times or you can't make out the dialogue. I find my Vizio sound bar from 2014 to sound fuller and richer at lower volumes though the bass is not nearly as intense. I prefer the cheaper, older Vizio.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cocaína

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the sound quality of this unit, including the clear voice, and bass which is very strong. Integrates with the TV flawlessly via HDMI(ARC). The app is also great - even better than the remote. The remote control only got 4 stars only because it's hard for my old eyes to see the small printing on it and it's not backlit, but it works well. Pairing this with other BT devices is easy and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Warkentin

customer_reviews.title: If you like dialogue do not buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar is good if you listen to loud music, or action shows. It’s horrible once the volume is turned down though. It seems like the soundbar doesn’t keep consistent volume at lower levels, and you cannot hear any dialogue without turning it wayyyy up. Overall I’m disappointed and out of my return window. I’ll be in talks with Yamaha and Amazon to exchange or return this. Definitely not worth almost $300.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Volmert

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I used a Polk sound bar before this one that was amazing for the price. I figured Yamaha was a good brand. I’m not impressed. The sound is hollow (lacks fullness). You can use the “surround” setting to fill it out to some degree, but I’m left wanting more. I purchased a “Bestisan” sound bar the other day and found it to be much better. All that said, it’s not awful. Just leaves me wanting something better. I do appreciate that it has a wireless subwoofer and it’s connection there is reliable. I just think you can get better sound for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, watch out for WIFI interference
customer_reviews.text: The bar relies on the subwoofer (wireless) to extend its range. However, the woofer was intermittently dropping in/out for me, and occasionally refusing to work altogether. My setup was soundbar under TV, woofer ~4 ft to the left, wireless router ~6 ft to the right. I was sure it was an issue with the woofer connection, even tried moving it directly under the TV, but in the end the only solution was to move my router. However, "moving the router" is easier said than done in some setups!! Aside from this annoyance, the soundbar works and sounds great. HDMI (ARC), seamless integration with samsung tv.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Just DO it
customer_reviews.text: Happen to log on to amazon when this was on sale for $160.00 a week ago. Listen to me, buy this sound bar. We have a $500.00 Sony soundbar/sub for our main rig in the living room. This sound bar goes toe to toe with it. Beautiful and I like the shape of the sub. Fits very nice next to the entertainment center. Easy to hook up. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great, remote disappointing, already does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for. My husband has a somas, no issues. I have had this one less than 4 months, sound works sometimes but not always. Today it stopped working. The worst part, no support. I got passed to seven people and then they disconnected me. Unfortunately no matter how hard I try I could not get one remote to work this unit. I need to turn on with my xfinity. Then control the volume with the sound bar remote. Disappointing, Sonas sound bar with my additional tv uses the xfinity remote only. It cost a lot more than this one. Don’t buy this unit,
customer_reviews.author: s Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Nice, simple 2.1 sound bar. Volume is not quite as much as I’d desire, but with the sub, it gets plenty loud. Only issue was trouble connecting to Bluetooth, and that turns out to be that the Bluetooth cannot be selected with Surround mode on...noted nowhere in manual and documantation. Also, will not connect to an iPhone 6, will connect to an 8
customer_reviews.author: Texas Transplant

customer_reviews.title: The soundbar is okay at best. Setup is simple and the wireless bass unit ...
customer_reviews.text: The soundbar is okay at best. Setup is simple and the wireless bass unit pairs with the main unit right out of the box. The strongest feature is the DTS surround sound which works magnificently after the latest firmware update but the bass is lacking and continually cuts in and out during on screen dialog which gets really distracting after a while. With such a large bass unit I figured it would perform better than my current smaller unit but with bass set to max it is still not that great. I'm hoping a newer firmware update will address the low bass.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wheat

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly worthless
customer_reviews.text: Shockingly worthless product. The name brand led me to order. My default TV sound has just as good sound. Wireless sub shows green light, says it is connected, yet provides little to no value. I hate returns and I am having a hard time justifying keeping this product. I would pay a bit more for better sound but this had high reviews so I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian MN

customer_reviews.title: Not a great substitute to the TV speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Yes it sounds better than the tv speakers but definitely didn’t blow me away like others who reviewed this item. I did the updates expecting some outstanding sound to coming but was left without any sense of excitement. I’m gac I could tell little difference. Maybe my expectations were to high since in the past I have always had a true surround system but this isn’t even close to that. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dudtal

customer_reviews.title: Awful Bass Crossover Issue
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned the bass is cutting in and out. When it cuts out, it will stutter and then the sound comes out completely flat. I reached out to customer support and they sent another sound bar to me for no charge. The new one was working well for a few weeks, but has recently started having the same issue. It has great sound when working properly, unfortunately it seems to be random at which times it will work and when it won’t.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Schwellenbach

customer_reviews.title: This Yamaha soundbar delivers rich, smooth sound for its price
customer_reviews.text: I like Yamaha products because they deliver as close to an audiophile experience as you can get on a budget. I have been skeptical of all the soundbars for years, but finally bought one. This is my first soundbar and it has far exceeded expectations. I have also had zero issues with it losing it paring/connection with the TV.
customer_reviews.author: aaron-the-baron

customer_reviews.title: 3-D Sound is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: My first time going with sound bar vs full home theater set up. I did thorough research on the best sound bar, that's under $1000. This one consistently rated out well. I would agree with those reviews. Easy set up, the wireless sub-woofer is even better than most wired ones i've heard before. Makes it much easier to hide. The sound bar, while using the 3-D sound, makes it sounds like you have a full set of surround sound speakers. I'm one to be skeptical of these sound "enhancements", but this is worth it. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality soundbar
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best solution for way better quality sound compared to tv speakers without having to cough up the cash for a quality receiver and speakers. This sound bar integrates very well with HDMI(ARC) and automatically powers on and off when various sources are turned on/off. Also, my tv remote controls the volume on it as well which is just one more thing I really like about it.
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after just 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty happy with my purchase in general, until the head unit stopped working completely just a few days after I purchased it. Warranty only covers it for 1 year, and it's $75 plus shipping of old unit to get a refurbished one back. The setup in my opinion could be a bit more straightforward with better instructions, and the software update made a nice improvement to the sound quality. In general, the Yamaha Yas 207 sound system did a great job of providing quality sound in my living. I was however not impressed with how it interacted with my Amazon Fire Cube. My biggest annoyance is the sound bar going completely dead after just 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy and the app worked well with it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to shrink the a/v rig in my now much smaller house. Setup was easy and the app worked well with it. After using it for several months I think it's pretty good sounding. The flash upgrade added another "wide surround" setting that to my ears sounds harsh and strange. The sub will occasionally not link with the bar. That is remedied by turning it off and on a couple times- really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price. But it's still not 5.1.
customer_reviews.text: I bough the Yamaha YAS-207BL on a whim because it was on sale for $168. I was looking for a 2.1 system and i decided to try this. I was actually pleasantly surprised. The system comes with an app, but it's limited in it's use. I find the Realtek Audio Manager equalizer helps out a good deal in getting the sound to an acceptable quality, but there is definitely no problem with the volume levels. It can get quite loud. The bass speaker is wireless and it paired instantly, so I just plugged it in behind the couch and used the SPDif to connect the sound bar to my PC.
customer_reviews.author: JOBY

customer_reviews.title: Love this Soundbar - a great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar is truly great! The 3D Surround sound is awesome and fills my living room perfectly! It is low profile and it fits perfectly right under my big screen - I barely notice that it is there until the sound almost knocks me off the couch! Download the iPhone app and you will be able to adjust the sound setting from your phone. You have to connect to Bluetooth and then you can fire up the app and select Clear Voice and 3d Surround and you will be all set!
customer_reviews.author: kjoconnor

customer_reviews.title: A relic before its time
customer_reviews.text: So right off the bat let me just, not compatible with Alexa, so that sucks. These speakers have "OK" sound, that's about it. The bass is decent but the mid's and highs have terrible sound. They can be very difficult to pair with your TV, stubborn is a better word. Finally, they are difficult to make work period. It took a lot of trial and error, so much so, I hope I never have to move...
customer_reviews.author: Donna J. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Added Good Sound to LG OLED TV
customer_reviews.text: Love the LG 65-in OLED TV, but hate the poor sound quality. Apparently lots of owners have this problem even if the sound is cranked up to near maximum. Tried the LG sound bar, but it was either out of sync or didn't add much. Changed that for the highly-rated Yamaha YAS-207BL and have been very pleased. I can now hear spoken words from the TV clearly, especially if I use the Clear Speech button. OK, the words aren't always what I'd like to hear, but at least I can distinguish them now even at low TV volume. Color me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Silkrip

customer_reviews.title: Beyond happy with quality sound from a small, cheap package
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Out of the box the HDMI ARC did work till the update. Once the update is applied it works amazing. Volume to spare. Sound features for music, TV, movies... I'm beyond happy. Would I have liked to play with Dolby Atoms? Sure. But our room is not what that is built for. This more than fills the space with high quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R Owen

customer_reviews.title: Piece of shit
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of crap, the subwoofer stopped working after only 3 months! When I called support I waited over 2 hours to get any help. Do not buy this, find a better brand with better support
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, but stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit about a year and a half ago. The sound quality was outstanding, powerful subwoofer and cristal clear details. But then, the unit first started creating connectivity issues with the cable TV feed that even the cable technicians were not able to resolve. This required unplugging and re-plugging the units and waiting for rebooting every single time I wanted to watch TV or movies. And then recently, the soundbar just stopped working, it basically does not turn on. Tried everything - manual activation, changing cables, batteries, following online recommendations, trying to reset the unit - nothing works. It is now out of the 1 year warranty period, so I am left with a dead sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: Dania S.

customer_reviews.title: not what i thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: the sound quality is awful. We have to raise and lower the volume in order to understand the dialog, then when we raise the sound to understand the dialog it blast us out of the room if there is an action scene. Not worth the money, sorry we didnt research more.
customer_reviews.author: robert ratti

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now you will not regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Really am impressed with this product. Purchased it for my new 4k HDTV and there is zero disappointment. I had worried not having a "true" 5.1 channel system would leave me wanting. I was wrong. You would think there were more speakers than there are. Amazing. Excellent all around.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Problems communicating with my LG TV
customer_reviews.text: HDMI ARC communication between my LG TV and the soundbar isn't working properly. Every time I turn both off and then back on, the soundbar switches from the HDMI input to "TV." Not sure yet if that's irritating enough to return it. Otherwise, the soundbar and subwoofer are fantastic, great sound for TV or playing music through my iphone.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: skip this junk move on to something better , would have returned it if i wasn't busy having a baby
customer_reviews.text: the app that controls this junk, yamaha should be ashamed to even call it an app,we are living in a world with multi tasking tech devices and this fails to measure up ,app is so limited it can't even do its primary job let alone multi task never worked as we would have liked it to, shame on them, this isn't the quality i would have expected from yamaha or amazon at this price,capabilities are very limited and the tech is outdated , was busy having a baby or i would have returned it
customer_reviews.author: Charms

customer_reviews.title: OK sound for price.  I miss my old receiver and 15-inch, 3-way speaker system
customer_reviews.text: I thought this soundbar would be louder per the RMS Watts. My Dennon receiver broke. Not that many receivers for sale as "everyone" is going the sound bar route. I miss the great sound of my older tech system. The sound is OK for price, several sound settings, such as surround sound, stereo, clear voice, bass extension control. I will probably need to spend approximately $1,200 on a soundbar to come close to my Dennon receiver with Pioneer 15-inch 3-way speakers (150 watt rating for each speaker).
customer_reviews.author: John C. Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: big booms
customer_reviews.text: even with the bass turned all the way down on the sub the bar alone has so much bass the walls shake and vibrate. I got this on sale around christmas for 150 so it was a complete steal. There is this special function on the remote that boosts voices my dad loves that feature. We are very happy with it and have had no problems with it once we read the directions and actually hooked it up the way it was supposed to be rather then winging it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sub-woofer doesn't connect; Extremely bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: The speaker was delivered very quickly. However, the sub-woofer doesn't work. Tried calling Yamaha for support. The customer service automatically drops off the call after 10 minutes of wait. The chat support shows 3 people in queue forever; nobody turns up. Awful product and even worse customer support.
customer_reviews.author: T & R

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, terrible I/O orientation.
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar is great for a mid to small TV room. The only problem (and it's a big problem) is the location/orientation of the HDMI in and out ports force your cables into a hard 90 degree turn in a tight area in the back of the unit. They are always coming loose and if you (or a toddler) jostle the soundbar at all, you basically have to push the cables back in or have signal issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Fuqua

customer_reviews.title: Subwoofer stopped connecting to main unit!
customer_reviews.text: Sounded good when it worked. Quit working in a few days. Yamaha tech tried several ways to fix it. He told me it was defective and would not work. I returned it to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Seaton

customer_reviews.title: Great sound without all the useless stuff
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good-sounding solution for my living room that wasn't full of buggy software. I needed it to just work. So far the YAS-207BL fits the bill. It is an couple of year-old model at this point, but I just wanted a sound bar that is a good sound bar and nothing else -- no integrated Chromecast, no voice control, and losing its sound settings every time it gets powered off. I'm tempted to get another one as a spare, just because it sounds great, does what I want it to, and nothing extra. Apparently, that is too much to ask these days.
customer_reviews.author: ncted

customer_reviews.title: It's okay......
customer_reviews.text: I bought this soundbar specifically for the DTS:X Virtual capability. I'm not sure how I feel about it. It seems more like a marketing thing than an actual technology. My subwoofer will randomly make a loud popping sound and sometimes I have to power cycle it to connect which is kind of frustrating. It's also disappointing that you can't add surround speakers like you can with some other soundbars. The sound quality is still good but I wouldn't repurchase this if all I was interested in was DTS:X Virtual.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last
customer_reviews.text: After about 6 month the bass stopped working. Yamaha replaced it with a reconditioned unit it worked approx six months and once again the subwoofer needs to be re-paired constantly, the hdmi doesn't always connect thru it requires pulling the power plug to get it to connect thru. The clear voice has little to no impact on hearing the voices over the background music. Very disappointing from a long time Yamaha fan.
customer_reviews.author: J D S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Soundbar at any price range. Top of the line.
customer_reviews.text: What a great soundbar. It really does a fantastic job at mimicking a 5.1 system. Its compact in size but large in sound output. I have it in a smaller room and its perfect. I got it on a daily deal but it's usually $299 and totally worth it. At the time of this writing it was $209, and that's a steal! Set up was simple. Its essential plug n play.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Poor Service & Remote Quality is Qustionable.
customer_reviews.text: The remote on our unit stopped working after only 2 weeks and we have been waiting for over 1.5 weeks for a service response as of this writing. Very poor service. The quality of this remote is questionable.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tebbe

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Went with this because of the reviews and I am quite pleased with this soundbar. Setup was easy, took me 15 min. I used the ARC so I can control the volume with my TV remote. Sound is good for stereo and very good when using the 3D SurroundSound feature. Remember this is just a soundbar with sub and will not compare to a proper 5.1 or 7.1 system if your expectations for the sound quality are reasonable, you will be very pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Good sound bar
customer_reviews.text: Nice mid-price range soundbar. I’ve had it installed for about a week now and have no complaints once I upgraded the firmware. The bass is adequate... it’s not going to rattle the glasses in the kitchen, but it’s a good compliment to the sound bar. I’m used to my onkyo reciever and 7.1 surround sound, so this is a back slide for me. I just don’t feel like running wires and hiding wires. That being said I’m not disappointed. The sound is good. Simulated surround sound is good.
customer_reviews.author: MC Soulcatcher

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar but can be improved
customer_reviews.text: I love Yamaha speakers .. I have a 5.1 sound system by them in my living room and it’s great but for some reason the sound bar just Dosent meet the best expectations I had. Something just seems odd about the sound quality and unfortunately with this product your only allowed the demo app meaning you get less sound control options. Though if you love base and music this is perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: Nikko

product_meta.title: Yamaha YAS-207BL Sound Bar with Wireless Subwoofer Bluetooth & DTS Virtual: X Black
product_meta.description: Style:SingleIt's never been easier to immerse yourself in clear, lifelike sound for all of your TV shows, movies, games and music. The world's first sound bar with DTS Virtual: X, the YAS-207 is capable of virtualizing sound in multiple dimensions - including height - offering more realistic sonic reproduction of any content without the complexity of using numerous speakers. The slim bar fits perfectly in front of your TV or can be wall-mounted, while the included wireless subwoofer can be placed anywhere in the room.
feature_bullets: World's first sound bar with DTS Virtual: X Virtual 3D surround sound (available via a firmware update available now)
Slim, understated design perfectly complements your TV
Wireless subwoofer for powerful bass with flexible placement
Simple setup with HDMI, optical or analog connection
